Code.CodeNotes: Use all J* codes for: specialist and some general adult titles, but see also V* codes for practical approaches to many topics. Use all J* codes with: other subject categories and qualifiers where appropriate. In J* use the most appropriate code(s) available, as many social sciences are broad topics that can have many alternative terms or names
Use all JB* codes for: both general and academic works on social topics. Use with: JH* codes for sociology textbooks and other specialist works as appropriate, See also: VFV*

Class here: intercultural studies, studies of cultural identity, general studies of cultural heritage, contemporary culture in society. Use with: PLACE 1*, LANGUAGE 2* or 5P* INTEREST Qualifiers to indicate the cultural studies of a particular region(s) or country / countries, language grouping or groups of people

Use for: the interdisciplinary field telling of relationships between people and their things, the role of artefacts and objects in society, the making, history, preservation, and interpretation of objects
Class here: ideas of beauty or body image in culture, fashions in different cultures or societies. Use with: NHTB for an historical approach or AKT* codes as appropriate

Use for: works that examine the traditions, habits, customs, rituals, ceremonies, taboos linked to food and drink in different cultures, food or drink as intangible cultural heritage. Use with: NHTB for an historical approach and with WB* codes as appropriate

Class here: studies of traditional rituals and ceremonies; cultural taboos or superstitions, social behaviour, values and norms as defined by society, institutions, traditions and cultural beliefs, See also: JBGB

Class here: cross-cultural encounters, cross-cultural exchanges, cultural clashes. Use for: works that examine social and cultural topics and issues around the meeting of different of cultures, including conflicts, negative or positive exchanges, on a personal or a societal level. Use with: NH* codes for historical topics
Use for: works about current debates, policies, ideas, controversies around the role of culture or cultural heritage in society
Use for: works that look at the expression, preservation, and change of human ideas over time. Use with: other J* or NH* or QD* codes as appropriate
See also: GTC

Code.CodeDescription: Media studies: internet, digital media and society
Code.CodeNotes: Use for: all aspects of online, digital and social media and their role or impact in society, including things such as blogging, tweeting, influencers, spread of real and false information, changing habits and behaviour linked to digital media, See also: ATN
Use for: works on both traditional and new forms of consuming small screen entertainment, including streaming and on demand services, impacts and influences on culture, links to popular culture, etc
See also: KNTP

Class here: propaganda, ‘fake news’. Use for: the purposeful use of false or misleading information, manipulation of thoughts and actions by use of information, the spread of misleading or non-fact based information. Use with: JBCT1 for works about the role of digital platforms
See also: PDR QDTQ RNT

Use for: works about various forms of discrimination, about equality or inequality, about prejudice based on a person’s identity and also about measures to address these issues, such as diversity and inclusion policies, positive discrimination, work on unconscious bias. Use with: other JB* categories, or other subject codes and Qualifiers to denote specific forms of discrimination, e.g. with JBSF* codes for sexism or discrimination based on gender, QRAM9 plus 5PG* codes for discrimination based on religion, JBSJ plus 5PS* codes for discrimination based on sexual orientation etc

Class here: institutional racism, xenophobia. Use for: works about discrimination and prejudice based on skin colour, race or ethnic origin, or prejudices based on the perception that someone is foreign or from outside the community, and issues of inequality and discrimination, as well as measures to address racism

Use for: works about food poverty, food banks, unemployment or employment when linked to poverty, the precariat, economic insecurity, underemployment, chaotic lifestyles, malnutrition linked to poverty, in-work poverty, the working poor etc
Class here: the unhoused, issues around providing houses, cost of homes, lack of accommodation etc
Class here: diseases, famine, malnutrition, forced movement of peoples as a result of disasters etc. Use with: other subject codes as appropriate, See also: RNR
Class here: asylum seekers, sanctuary. Use with: other codes for specific topics, such as JBFA for discrimination, JBFD for housing topics, NHTB for social history, FX for novels, etc

Class here: the Underground Railroad, the Comet Line, Fluchthilfe, etc. Use for: titles about helping refugees escape repression, slavery, conflicts etc. Use with: NH* codes and PLACE 1* and TIME PERIOD 3* Qualifiers as appropriate

Use for: works about diasporas, expatriates, settlers or the migrants themselves, or cultural or social topics linked to migration. Use with: other codes for specific topics, such as JBFA for discrimination, JBFD for housing topics, NHTB for social history, FX for novels etc
Class here: forced labour, forced marriage, sexual slavery, modern-day slavery, forced prostitution, child labour, See also: NHTS

Class here: ill-treatment, maltreatment or wilful neglect in society, violence based on cultural traditions, violence against particular groups or individuals, institutional violence, violent criminal behaviour in society etc. Use for: works about perceptions of violence and insecurity in society, as well as works on actual violence, abuse and neglect, See also: JKV
Class here: child neglect
Class here: sexual violence, rape, sexual assault, See also: JKVN
Class here: domestic violence, family violence, intimate partner violence, coercive control, gaslighting, master suppression techniques and countermeasures

Class here: mobbing, social media trolling, cyberbullying, intimidation, coercion, mobbing, stalking and threatening behaviour. Use with: JBCT* codes when linked to different kinds of media, KNXC or KJMV2 for workplace harassment

Code.CodeDescription: Control, privacy and safety in society
Code.CodeNotes: Use for: issues and debates around privacy, use of data, the role of government and big corporations, security, anti-terrorism, rights of the individual versus the rights of society, surveillance, public safety, social control and coercion, See also: JPV

Use for: works that look at societal barriers to a person with impairments, the way societies treat disabled persons, the impact of policies, etc. Use with: 5PM* Qualifiers as appropriate and other codes for specific topics, such as JBFA for discrimination, JBFD for housing topics, JKS* for welfare, NHTB for social history, FX for novels etc

Code.CodeDescription: Health, illness and addiction: social aspects
Code.CodeNotes: Use for: studies of the social or cultural impact of health policies or different illnesses or addictions; social or cultural behaviour or reactions to different types of addictions, illnesses or health scares. Use with: MBP to indicate social aspects of health systems

Class here: drug or alcohol addiction, opioid addiction, substance abuse. Use for: works about impact of drugs and alcohol addiction or abuse on society, groups or individuals, intervention strategies, public policies etc
Class here: animal rights, vivisection, hunting, animal welfare, the use of animals for food, as resources, as commodities, human impact on animal world, trade in animals etc, treated as issues
Use with: other categories to indicate works that treat a subject as an ethical debate, See also: PSAD QDTQ

Code.CodeDescription: Ethical issues: abortion and birth control

Code.CodeNotes: Class here: the death penalty
Class here: debates around freedom of speech, censorship vs security, etc

Code.CodeDescription: Ethical issues: euthanasia and right to die
Code.CodeNotes: Class here: assisted suicide, assisted death. Use with: LNT for legal aspects

Code.CodeDescription: Ethical issues: scientific, technological and medical developments

Code.CodeNotes: Use for: general interest works on sex and society, pornography and the sex industry, sex work and prostitution, See also: JMU VFVC
Class here: political correctness. Use for: general works about social, political and moral attitudes in societies. Use with: other categories for attitudes towards particular subjects or groups

Use for: non-fiction studies of traditional stories or material, verbal or customary folklore; studies of urban and contemporary myths and legends; studies of the origins of myths, fairy tales, tall-stories, paranormal tales, supernatural beings, Old wives’ tales, popular superstitions etc; specialist works about the origin of the stories of Atlantis, the Holy Grail, the Hidden Folk, the Bermuda Triangle, the Green Man etc. Prefer: QR* codes for the spiritual or religious aspects of mythology or VX* codes for more popular approaches or FN* codes for the stories themselves, See also: FN QRS* VXQM*
Class here: hoaxes, cover ups etc
Use all JBS* codes with: other codes for specific topics, such as JBFA for discrimination, NHTB for social history, FX* for novels and INTEREST 5* Qualifiers as appropriate

Class here: class conflict, social stratification, socio-economic groups. Use for: works that examine class, a particular class, characteristics and distinctions of that class, interaction between different strata of society, perceptions and prejudices about particular classes
Class here: small settlements in rural areas, people living in the countryside, semi-rural areas, isolated communities
Class here: inner cities, suburbs, city and town dwellers, suburban communities. Use for: any works on urban or semi-urban settings

Use for: works that examine social roles based on the sex of the person (gender role) or personal identification of one’s own gender based on an internal awareness (gender identity), as well as works that look at sex (based on the anatomy of an individual’s reproductive system, and secondary sex characteristics), including intersex people
Class here: Women’s studies. Use with: other subject codes when a work is primarily about women or girls. Use with: JBFA for discrimination based on gender or sexism, NHTB for women’s history, etc
Class here: Men’s studies, topics around masculinity. Use with: other subject codes when a work is primarily about men or boys

Code.CodeDescription: Gender studies: ‘trans’, transgender people and gender variance
Code.CodeNotes: Class here: transsexual, transgender, gender non-conforming, non-binary, genderqueer, gender minority, two spirit, third gender etc. Use for: works that look at those whose gender is different (wholly or partially) from that assigned to them at birth, or gender variance in cultures who have established more than two genders. Use with: JBFA for issues around discrimination and transphobia

Class here: queer studies, sexual diversity studies. Use for: studies of sexuality, sexual orientation and associated identity-based groups or cultures. Use with: other codes for specific topics, e.g. JBFA for homophobia or issues around discrimination or NHTB for LGBTQ+ history and 5PS* values from INTEREST 5* Qualifiers, as appropriate, See also: JBSF3
Use with: other subject codes for interdisciplinary studies and PLACE 1* and 5PB* values from INTEREST 5* Qualifiers, as appropriate
Class here: race relations, ethnic minorities, multiculturalism. Use for: works on social and cultural topics linked to multicultural societies, See also: JBFA

Code.CodeDescription: Mixed heritage / mixed race groups or people

Code.CodeNotes: Use for: works that look at different generations, or topics, issues, problems for different generations or generational misunderstandings or conflicts, intergenerational topics, etc

Code.CodeDescription: Social groups: religious groups and communities
Code.CodeNotes: Use with: 5PG* values from INTEREST 5* Qualifiers and QR* codes as appropriate
Use for: lifestyles that are diverse in regards to the mainstream or perceived to be outside the cultural norms
Class here: freemasonry, See also: QRY* FHQ
Class here: voluntary association or ‘elective affinities’, how and why people join and associate themselves with specific groups
Use all JH* codes for: textbooks or academic and specialist works. Use with: other J* codes indicating specific topics where appropriate
See also: LAQ MBS
See also: GPS

Use for: works about family structures, relationships within families, social networks, peer-groups, friendships, sociology of physical and emotional relationships with other people, social control or conformity within groups or families, etc, See also: JBFW VFV*
Class here: sociology of employment / unemployment
See also: VFJX
Class here: ethnography, kinship and family, Institutional anthropology, sociocultural anthropology. Use with: other J* codes for different specialities in anthropology, See also: JBCC*
Class here: child protection and safeguarding, social work services aimed at support of vulnerable/under-privileged youths in society, See also: LNMK
Class here: elder abuse, maltreatment and neglect, institutions for the care of older people. Use for: social care aspect, community and government policies and associated professions or roles

Code.CodeDescription: Care of people with specific needs
Code.CodeNotes: Class here: care of people with visible or hidden disabilities, people with physical and sensory impairments, care of neurodivergent persons with additional needs. Use for: social care aspect, community and government policies and associated professions or roles. Use with: 5PM* qualifiers as appropriate

Code.CodeDescription: Care of people with mental health issues
Code.CodeNotes: Use for: social care aspect, community and government policies and associated professions or roles. Use with: 5PM* qualifiers as appropriate, See also: MBPK VFJQ

Class here: works on international and foreign aid or assistance, humanitarian aid, disaster relief. Use for: domestic and international programmes, either short term or long term aid programmes, relief initiatives etc
Use for: non-medical works about paramedical and equivalent emergency services, See also: MQF
See also: DNXC
Class here: surveillance, anti-terrorism measures, protection of the public from crime, policies around prevention and causes of crime, Social control theory
See also: JMK MKT
Class here: mugging, pickpocketing, vandalism, knife crime, gun crime
Class here: financial crimes, fraud, scams, embezzlement, bribery and corruption etc
Class here: criminal gangs, mafia, banditry, piracy

Class here: murder, unlawful killings, kidnapping, torture, assault, honour crimes, rape and crimes of sexual violence, etc. Use for: works that examine different aspects of different types of violent crime. Use with: DNXC* codes for journalistic style accounts of actual violent crimes
Class here: prisons, penitentiaries, penal systems and theories, See also: JWXR
Class here: juvenile delinquency
Class here: victim’s rights, See also: DNXR
Use all JM* codes for: academic, specialist and professional level works. Prefer: VS* codes for practical advice for the general reader, See also: VSP*

Code.CodeDescription: Psychological theory, systems, schools and viewpoints
Code.CodeNotes: See also: QDTM
Class here: psychoanalysis
Class here: psychometrics
See also: JNC
Class here: psychology of communication, both verbal and non-verbal, See also: GTC
See also: SCGP
See also: JKV*
See also: MKM*
Class here: affective neuroscience
Class here: Cognitive neuroscience, psychological works on learning, memory and memory loss, intelligence, reasoning, perception

Code.CodeDescription: Psychology: the self, ego, identity, personality

Code.CodeNotes: Class here: psychological works on conscious and unconscious mind; sleep and dreams; altered states of mind, hypnosis, drug-induced, etc, See also: VXN
See also: VFVC JBFW
Use for: serious academic works, See also: VXP
Use all JN* codes for: works about education as a practice or subject, but use YP* codes for schoolbooks or educational material for pupils in pre-tertiary education

Code.CodeDescription: Moral and social purpose of education
Code.CodeNotes: Use for: works supporting the theories behind education focussed particularly on themes connected to society and behaviour in it
Class here: history of specific schools, colleges, as well as general history
Class here: issues of selection, admissions, inspection, governance etc. Use with: PLACE 1* Qualifiers for comparisons between different education systems
Use for: works about social pedagogy as a field of study
Class here: teaching strategies for literacy, numeracy etc; policies regarding streaming etc
Class here: pastoral care, student welfare issues, absence, truancy, discipline, safety in educational establishments, child protection in schools etc
Use for: both formulating policy and practical applications
Use for: works aimed at professionals dealing with childcare or general works on subject, See also: JNLA

Code.CodeDescription: Funding of education and student finance

Code.CodeNotes: See also: VSK
Class here: elementary, preparatory, infant and junior schools
Class here: senior and high schools
Class here: adventure education, outdoor learning, forest schools. Use for: organized learning that takes place in the outdoors
Class here: all advanced and post-secondary education, including institutions offering vocational, technical or non-degree courses as well as universities, See also: VSK

Class here: lifelong learning, popular education, community education, ‘Bildung’. Use for: works about education or training of adult learners that are neither university nor vocational training, See also: VSL VSN

Use for: works on industrial / vocational training, professional development and education as a subject. Prefer: YPW* or other subjects codes, such as T*, and the appropriate 4CP* Qualifiers for teaching material and coursework for teaching vocational subjects

Code.CodeDescription: Teaching of students with different educational needs
Code.CodeNotes: Class here: special education, mixed classes of students with different cultural or linguistic backgrounds etc

Code.CodeDescription: Teaching of students with physical impairments or disabilities
Code.CodeNotes: Use for: teaching of students with impaired hearing or vision, or any physical condition giving rise to specific educational needs. Use with: 5PM* codes as appropriate

Code.CodeDescription: Teaching of students with learning difficulties
Code.CodeNotes: Use for: teaching of students with dyslexia, dyscalculia, autism, behavioural difficulties, or any mental impairment giving rise to specific educational needs

Code.CodeDescription: Teaching of students with social, emotional or behavioural difficulties
Teaching of gifted or talented students

Code.CodeNotes: Class here: developmental education, compensatory education

Code.CodeDescription: Education of bilingual or multilingual students
Code.CodeNotes: Class here: works looking at the theory of education through a secondary language, education in mixed language classes, works about the education of pupils who speak another language, but where the language teaching itself is not the focus of the education
Class here: classroom control, coaching and mentoring, lesson planning, tutoring
Class here: competency-based education and training, competency learning. Use for: works that examine the practical approach to developing competencies and concrete skills in education or training
Use for: works that examine the theories or approaches to using play and activity to teach and learn

Code.CodeDescription: Teaching of reading, writing and numeracy
Code.CodeNotes: Use for: works about the theory or different approaches of learning or teaching the basic skills, See also: CJCR CJCW JNF YPCA2
Use with: the code for the subject taught, using YP* Educational codes where appropriate
Class here: interactive resources, teachers’ editions of textbooks, learning materials and teaching aids etc. Use with: the code for the subject taught, using YP* Educational codes where appropriate
Use with: the code for the subject taught, using YP* Educational codes where appropriate

Code.CodeDescription: Educational equipment and technology, computer-aided learning (CAL)
Code.CodeNotes: Class here: media technology in classroom, Learning management systems. Use for: works about using digital technologies in class and for learning
Class here: field trips, school trips, sporting and community activities, events, performances, playtime/mealtime, after-school activities, school clubs etc
See also: QDTS
Use for: works on different parts of the political spectrum
Class here: green movements, activist organisations, See also: RNA RNB
Class here: Communism, Marxism-Leninism, Trotskyism, Maoism, extreme-left, radical left, hard left, democratic socialists, populist socialists, social populists, left-wing populism
Class here: social democracy, socialism
Class here: Communitarianism, Centrism
Class here: Conservatism, Christian Democracy

Class here: ethnic nationalism, language nationalism, nationalist or nativist movements. Use for: works that examine any form of nationalism. Use with: NH* codes for history titles and INTEREST 5* Qualifiers as appropriate

Use for: works about specific forms of nationalism that look beyond traditional boundaries of basic national identities, in order to create a ‘higher’ pan-national (all-inclusive) identity, based on various common denominators. Use with: NH* codes for history titles and INTEREST 5* Qualifiers as appropriate
Class here: Fascism and neo-fascism, Nazism and neo-Nazism, ultra-nationalism, Extreme right, alt right, hard right, radical right, Palaeoconservatism, nativism, right-wing populism
Class here: Theocracy. Use for: works about religion used as a source of political ideology, identity or action. Use with: QR* codes to indicate particular religion as appropriate

Class here: psephology, voting systems, suffrage. Use for: works both on the study of, as well as on specific elections or referendums, studies of voting behaviour, types of electoral and voting practices
Class here: authoritarianism, tyranny, absolutism

Use for: works that look at individual or multiple political parties, or examine particular party platforms or programs. Use with: JPF* codes for works about a particular party on the political spectrum
Class here: works on policies, government
See also: KNV
See also: KCP

Code.CodeDescription: Regional, state and other local government
Code.CodeNotes: Use for: any government within a country that is not municipal or city based (these are within scope of JPT), See also: JPT

Code.CodeDescription: Regional, state and other local government policies
Code.CodeNotes: Use for: policy of any government within a country that is not municipal or city based (these are within scope of JPT), See also: JPT
Class here: International politics, foreign policy
Class here: arms race, arms stockpiling, disarmament
Class here: surveillance, counterintelligence, spying, military intelligence
Class here: UN and UN agencies, EU institutions, intergovernmental and non-governmental organizations (IGOs and NGOs) etc. Use with: 1QF* values from PLACE 1* Qualifiers as appropriate, See also: GTV
Use for: city regions (e.g. Greater London or the Bay Area), metropolitan areas or key subdivisions of urban areas such as boroughs
Class here: political propaganda
Class here: freedom of speech, of information, of worship; land rights, etc, See also: LNDC

Use for: works about forced abduction, imprisonment, or unlawful killings used as a form of political oppression, the ‘Disappeared’ in various societies, the search for the people or their bodies, etc. Use with: LBBR or LNDC for legal aspects or NH* codes for historical material

Code.CodeDescription: Pressure groups, protest movements and non-violent action
Code.CodeNotes: Class here: lobbying, demonstrations, civil disobedience, peaceful resistance, active defiance of authority
Class here: political assassination, See also: JWCG
See also: NHTV
Class here: uprisings, armed skirmishes, flashpoints, outbreaks of organized violence short of full-scale war

Code.CodeDescription: Corruption in politics, government and society
Code.CodeNotes: Class here: government and public sector corruption, judicial and police corruption, bribery and corruption as part of everyday life in society etc, See also: JKV*

Code.CodeDescription: Theory of warfare and military science
Code.CodeNotes: Use with: RG* codes for Military Geography topics

Code.CodeDescription: Irregular or guerrilla forces and warfare
Code.CodeNotes: Class here: armed resistance movements, insurgents, foreign fighters. Use for: works about non-regular military forces who fight for political, economic, ideological or religious reasons. Use with: NHW* codes as appropriate and PLACE 1* and TIME PERIOD 3* Qualifiers as appropriate
See also: NHTM
Class here: personnel issues, discipline, procurement, funding etc
Class here: military tactics, civil defence, national security policies
See also: NHW*
See also: GTU
Use with: code from JWC* to indicate sector, See also: WCK
Use with: code from JWC* to indicate sector and WG* as appropriate
Class here: regiments, memorials, war cemeteries, rolls of honour, command centres, defence institutions, military academies, organisations for veterans or ex-combatants etc, See also: AMG WCK
See also: TTM
Class here: Armaments, weapons industry
Class here: civilians, journalists, aid workers, combat medics, military chaplains, neutrals etc
See also: NHTZ NHTZ1
Class here: soldiers of fortune, private armies and private defence companies. Use for: works about soldiers who fight for money or personal gain

Use all P* codes for: mostly academic, technical and specialist titles and some general adult works. Qualifiers are mostly not required with P* codes. DO NOT USE: code ‘P’ itself, but select specific categories from section P*. Prefer: WN* codes for general interest adult titles where appropriate
Class here: finite mathematics
Class here: Fourier, Hilbert, Laplace, Z transforms
See also: PDE TBJ UYAM
Use for: the natural sciences as well as general works on the different branches of science. Use with: other subject codes as appropriate
See also: PBW

Code.CodeDescription: Industrial applications of scientific research and technological innovation

Code.CodeNotes: Use for: works on regulation, whether legal or directed by other bodies or authorities, aimed at scientists and practitioners. Use with: other P* code indicating area of science where appropriate, See also: LNDB8

Code.CodeDescription: Impact of science and technology on society
Code.CodeNotes: Use for: works that look that at impact that any science or technology has had or could have on society. Use with: NHTB for social history or other P* or T* or J* codes as appropriate, See also: JBFV5 UBJ
Use for: nanomaterials, nanomaterial synthesis, nanoparticle chemistry, See also: TBN
See also: TBX
Use with: other P* code indicating area of science given popular treatment, See also: WNW* WNX
Use with: other PB* codes indicating the area of maths given popular treatment as appropriate
See also: TTD*
See also: PHVB

Code.CodeDescription: Astronomical observation: observatories, equipment and methods
Code.CodeNotes: See also: WNX
Class here: exoplanets, extrasolar planets

Code.CodeDescription: Solar system: the Sun and planets
Code.CodeNotes: Class here: the Moons of the different planets

Code.CodeDescription: Condensed matter physics (liquid state and solid state physics)

Code.CodeNotes: Class here: Microphysics

Code.CodeDescription: Quantum physics (quantum mechanics and quantum field theory)

Code.CodeNotes: Class here: physics of time
Class here: computational physics
See also: RBG*
See also: TDC TQ*
Class here: drug discovery and design, drug development, See also: MKG
Class here: atmospheric, soil and water chemistry, chemical pollution and remediation. Use TQ* for practical applications of environmental chemistry, See also: RBGK TQ*
Class here: food science. Prefer: TDCT2 for more practical applications, See also: TDCT2
Class here: battery chemistry

Code.CodeDescription: Chemistry of minerals, crystals and gems

Code.CodeNotes: Use all PS* codes for: academic, specialist and professional level works. Prefer: WN* codes for natural history etc for the general reader, See also: WN*
Use for: issues surrounding the ethics of practices typically connected to new developments in biology and medicine, See also: JBFV MBDC
Use for: comprehensive scientific, objective and descriptive works on living organisms and their relationship with their environment, See also: RNC
Class here: DNA, Genome etc, See also: MFN TCBG
Prefer: MKMT6 “Cognitive behavioural therapy” for therapeutic aspects of neuroscience, See also: GTK MKJ MKMT6
See also: MBF
Class here: biochemical immunology, non-medical toxicology, enzymology, lipids etc
Class here: synthetic biology
Class here: protozoa, non-medical bacteriology, parasitology, virology etc
See also: RBK
See also: RBKF
See also: RBKC
Class here: lichen
Class here: cycads, Ginkgo and gnetophytes
Class here: clubmosses, hornworts
See also: WNC
Class here: annelids (worms), Myriapoda, echinoderms (starfish, sea urchins), jellyfish, See also: WNCN
Class here: caterpillars, butterflies and moths
Class here: crabs, lobsters, crayfish, shrimp, krill, woodlice, barnacles etc
Class here: cephalopod, octopus, squid, gastropods, snails, slugs, bivalves, clams, oysters, cockles, mussels, scallops etc
Class here: spiders, scorpions, ticks, mites etc
See also: WNCS
See also: WNCK
See also: WNCB
See also: WNCF
Class here: Cetacea and Sirenia – whales, dolphins, sea cows, etc. Use for: aquatic and semiaquatic mammals, See also: PSVM WNCS
Class here: lemurs, monkeys, apes
Class here: early man, palaeoanthropology, Hominidae, human forebears and archaic humans

Use all U* codes for: academic, technical, specialist and some general adult titles. DO NOT USE: code ‘U’ itself, but select specific categories from section U*. Use all U* codes with: other subject categories and qualifiers where appropriate, in particular EDUCATIONAL PURPOSE 4* qualifiers for vocational educational titles

Code.CodeDescription: History of Computing, digital and information technologies
Digital and information technologies: Health and safety aspects
Digital and information technologies: social and ethical aspects
Code.CodeNotes: Class here: Digital divide, Industry 4.0, Internet of things, smart cities, social technology, smart homes, intelligent environments, etc. Use for: works that look at issues or impacts on society, linked to the uses or changes to society associated with computer, digital or information technologies, the internet, See also: JBFV5 PDR

Code.CodeDescription: Digital and information technologies: Legal aspects
Code.CodeNotes: Class here: legal aspects of open source, copyleft licensing, spamming, net neutrality, internet censorship, all legal aspects of the digital dissemination of information and software. Use for: works that discuss various legal aspects of IT, See also: LNQ
Use for: general works on technology-led subcultures

Code.CodeDescription: Digital Lifestyle and online world: consumer and user guides
Code.CodeNotes: Use for: general works, usually aimed at a basic, introductory, non-specialist level or guides to help users make informed choices about digital technologies, See also: ATN
See also: ATN

Code.CodeDescription: E-book readers, tablets and other portable devices: consumer / user guides
Digital music and audio: consumer / user guides
Code.CodeNotes: See also: ATN
Use for: all consumer/user guides to digital photography. Use with: AJT for general and artistic aspects or UGP for technical works on editing and software such as Photoshop, See also: AJT UGP

Code.CodeDescription: Mobile phones and smartphones: consumer / user guides
Digital TV and media centres: consumer / user guides
Computer games / online games: strategy guides
Smart home technology and virtual assistants: consumer / guides
Code.CodeNotes: Use for: general practical works, usually aimed at a basic, non-specialist, level or guides to help users make informed choices about smart technologies or the internet of things

Class here: Excel, Lotus 1-2-3, etc
Class here: content management system (CMS), customer relationship management (CRM), enterprise resource planning (ERP)

Accessibility in web and digital design
Code.CodeNotes: Class here: accessibility in digital products, accessible digital publishing, Electronic accessibility
Use for: logical and narrative aspects of games design, See also: AKLF

Use for: technical or professional works about smart home technologies, interconnected smart devices, internet of things, systems of interrelated computing devices, mechanical and digital machines or objects
Class here: mac OS, use with ULP to indicate iOS, See also: ULP

Code.CodeDescription: Open source and other operating systems
Mobile and other handheld operating systems
Code.CodeNotes: Class here: Android, iOS, Blackberry, Tizen. Use for: mobile OS for phones, tablets and smart watches, See also: ULD ULH

Code.CodeDescription: Mobile and handheld device programming / Apps programming

Code.CodeNotes: Class here: Non-relational databases
Class here: infographics, data visualisation, big data, data sets, data analytics, data science, See also: GPH
Class here: blockchain, cryptocurrencies
Class here: BitTorrent, Freenet
Class here: Oracle, Access, SQL etc
Class here: maker guides, home automation etc

Computer applications in the social and behavioural sciences
